feed.subtitle: Use the links above to learn more, see my work and get in touch.

entry.title: ‘Future-Hack’ - Winning a trip to San Francisco

link.title: 'Future-Hack' - Winning a trip to San Francisco

entry.content:
This was a 3 day hackathon hosted by McKinsey Digital in Johannesburg, South Africa. Our team built a recruitment tool based on a JHipster backend and an Android app. The product placed students with companies to allow them to find job shadow opportunities and then follow on with job placements if the job shadow proves to be successful.

Our team placed first after a very gruelling three days spent building out the prototype and developing a proof of concept. We spent easily the most time up front establishing a strong relationship amongst the team and working on a solid strategy before beginning to build and narrow in on our build plans, and this paid off as our product proved to be the most viable, empathetic and strategic.

We also managed to put together some very minor marketing material to communicate our idea:
entry.summary: This was a 3 day hackathon hosted by McKinsey Digital in Johannesburg, South Africa. Our team built a recruitment tool based on a JHipster backend and an Android app. The product placed students with companies to allow them to find job shadow opportunities and then follow on with job placements if the job shadow proves to be successful.

entry.title: Datafest London
entry.content: I attended Denodo Datafest in London, this was an exceptionally good opportunity to understand the product roadmap and how other clients are using and gaining value from the product. I also attended the Customer Advisory Panel to try and assist with the roadmap development of the product. See Livestream here: https://www.denodo.com/en/page/denodo-datafest-2017-sessions
entry.summary: A conference in London that led to a few opportunities.

entry.title: Kayachat
entry.content:
While mentoring a high-school student, I realised that some aspects of the work I was doing would have been sensible to be automated. This gave me a reason to try and build a chat-bot, the results of which can be found here

This became my entry to the McKinsey Future-Hack Hackathon, and is something I still think could be valuable
entry.summary: While mentoring a high-school student, I realised that some aspects of the work I was doing would have been sensible to be automated. This gave me a reason to try and build a chat-bot, the results of which can be found here This became my entry to the McKinsey Future-Hack Hackathon, and is something I still think could be valuable.
